button_url_new_window="1" use_rating="on" rating_alignment="center" rating_position="rating-top" rating_icon_size="41px" rating_color="#FFD700" blank_color="#FFFFFF" _builder_version="4.17.4" âI was extremely pleased with my experience at Southern Skies. Dr. Mario and his NP, Adrienne, removed a large basal cell on the top of my lip. It was a very extensive procedure resulting in more than 40 external stitches. Within a month the scar was barely noticeable. Much care and thought were given to how and where to make the incisions. Taking into account my facial creases, wrinkles, etc., the scar is almost completely hidden. I recommend them highly!â

[/dica_divi_carouselitem][dica_divi_carouselitem title="Rebecca Long, Gadsden" button_url_new_window="1" use_rating="on" rating_alignment="center" rating_position="rating-top" rating_icon_size="41px" rating_color="#FFD700" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="default" header_level="h2" header_text_align="center" header_font_size="20px" body_text_align="center" global_colors_info="{}"]

âIâm very pleased with the care and concern of this staff. Dr. M did a great job on my ear. The reconstruction looks wonderful. You have to look really close to tell anything was done. They are professionals, but they treat me like family.âÂ

With more than 40 years in business, Southern Skies Dermatology and Surgery is proud to serve the Alabama communities of Trussville in Birmingham, Pell City, and Gadsden. As the third generation of physicians in this practice, we focus primarily on skin cancer diagnosis and treatment, which has resulted in our practice becoming one of the highest-volume skin cancer exam, biopsy, and treatment groups in the United States.

Our mentality is that by focusing our energy and attention on one thing, skin cancer, we can do that one thing phenomenally well.Â  If youâre looking for expert dermatologists in Birmingham, Pell City, or Gadsden, schedule your appointment with us today and see why so many of our patients trust us with their skin health!

Our team comes with a variety of experiences and is happy to help patients understand how each treatment will work for them.Â

What Makes Us Different

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src="https://southernskiesdermatology.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/Divider.svg" title_text="Divider" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="04d09abd-7579-4b9c-808e-c7ad250d8198" custom_margin="||||false|false" locked="off" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" text_font="Roboto||||||||" text_line_height="33px" text_orientation_tablet="left" text_orientation_phone="center" text_orientation_last_edited="on|phone" global_colors_info="{}"]

At Southern Skies Dermatology, we feel that the best way to create a first-class experience for our patients is to first create a first-class experience for our employees. By prioritizing our work culture and making Southern Skies Dermatology and Surgery a positive, fun, rewarding place to work - we believe that we attract exceptional employees.Â 

Our practice administrator, Michelle Flowers, once told Dr. Mario, that we have to make sure we donât âoverwork and underpayâ our staff or they wonât take pride in working here, and they wonât stick around for the long haul. Dr. Mario took that to heart and wanted to go even further.

We reward our team with free take-out for lunch every Thursday (group vote decision), a spin-the-wheel birthday prize, quarterly cash rewards for being a reliably consistent employee, regular raises, unexpected bonuses for exceptional performance, and a healthy Christmas bonus, as well as a fabulously fun Christmas party.Â Â 

Phenomenal patient care comes from a team that is invested and ready to contribute to our practice. Weâve built a work family that includes doctors, advanced practice providers, front office staff, medical assistants, billing staff, laboratory personnel, many wonderful local vendors, and most importantly our patients whom we are extremely proud of.

[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]

1. It's unclear which versions to include/exclude from their indexes.

Dr. Mario Maruthur

MD

Dr. Maruthur is a Fellowship-trained and Board-Certified Mohs Micrographic surgeonÂ andÂ Board-Certified Dermatologist that focuses exclusively on skin cancer treatment. While his father was born in Kerala, India, and his mother was from Chicago, IL, he was born and raised in Hot Springs, Arkansas, where his father practiced medicine as an endocrinologist specializing in diabetes. After graduating as the valedictorian of his high school class, he attended Rhodes College in Memphis, TN, where he obtained a Bachelor of Science degree in Biology...keep reading[/et_pb_text][/et_pb_column][et_pb_column type="1_3" module_class="team-member" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="default" border_radii="on|10px|10px|10px|10px" global_colors_info="{}"][et_pb_image src="https://southernskiesdermatology.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/06/Barbie.jpg" alt="Barbie" title_text="Barbie" force_fullwidth="on" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="default" custom_margin="0px||0px||false|false" custom_padding="0px||0px||false|false" border_radii="off|10px|10px||" locked="off" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text module_class="pa-toggle-text" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="3d1935f0-c622-48ce-824e-be21cacd454f" link_text_color="#0B61C7" header_4_text_color="#0B61C7" custom_padding="20px|20px|0px|20px|false|true" header_3_font_size_tablet="" header_3_font_size_phone="20px" header_3_font_size_last_edited="on|phone" locked="off" global_colors_info="{%22gcid-3f7cd2dc-b68c-4cc5-803f-18348add3227%22:%91%22link_text_color__hover%22,%22link_text_color__hover%22%93,%22gcid-67ca45d1-e275-42f7-b775-97f0494dc78c%22:%91%22link_text_color%22%93}" link_text_color__hover_enabled="on|hover" link_text_color__hover="#007DBD"]

Barbie Curren

Front Desk Supervisor/Billing

Tabatha Platts

Our Approach to Medical Care

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src="https://southernskiesdermatology.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Divider-small-new-yellow.png" title_text="Divider" align_tablet="left" align_phone="center" align_last_edited="on|phone" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="default" locked="off" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="399dc1c6-5b92-4bd9-a1dd-0455d30e3551" global_colors_info="{}"]

Southern Skies Dermatology and Surgery is dedicated to diagnosing and treating skin cancer at our Birmingham/Trussville, Pell City, and Gadsden dermatology and surgery clinics. Our philosophy is that we are here to help, and we do that best by focusing on our area of expertise.

We believe your skin health is vital to your well-being, and every individual should have access to personal and affordable care. We specialize in the detection and treatment of skin cancers, which is often a worrying diagnosis for patients. Youâll always be greeted with a smile and can expect friendly services from each of our staff members. We believe in staying in close communication with our patients before, during, and after their medical visits with follow-up calls and emails.

A priority in our practice is working to continually improve the patient experience. This means creating more appointment spots when our patient backlog gets long, staying aware of our visit wait times to keep them fast and convenient, and taking to heart the feedback that we receive from patients.Â Â 

We also understand that our patients have varied experiences with dermatologists, and embark on treatments that are complicated and stressful. Our staff does our best to alleviate your worries with understanding and patience. Our doctors and advanced practice providers (APPs) are encouraged to continually expand their knowledge so our patients across Alabama receive the latest evidence-based, high-quality medical care.

âI was extremely pleased with my experience at Southern Skies. Dr. Mario and his NP, Adrienne, removed a large basal cell on the top of my lip. It was a very extensive procedure resulting in more than 40 external stitches. Within a month the scar was barely noticeable. Much care and thought were given to how and where to make the incisions. Taking into account my facial creases, wrinkles, etc., the scar is almost completely hidden. I recommend them highly!â

1. It's unclear which versions to include/exclude from their indexes.
2. They don't know whether to direct the link metrics (trust, authority, anchor text, link equity, etc.) to one page, or keep it separated between multiple versions.

So whilst there's no direct penalty, if your content isn't unique then search engine algorithms could be filtering out your articles from their results. The easiest way to make sure this doesn't happen is to try and make each of your posts and pages as unique as possible, hence specifying different focus keywords for each article you write.

Frequently Asked Questions

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src="https://southernskiesdermatology.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Divider-small-new-yellow.png" title_text="Divider" align="center" align_tablet="center" align_phone="" align_last_edited="on|tablet" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="04d09abd-7579-4b9c-808e-c7ad250d8198" locked="off" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_image][et_pb_accordion open_toggle_text_color="#0B61C7" closed_toggle_background_color="#0B61C7" _builder_version="4.21.0" _module_preset="bfc4e6c6-6cf5-4fa5-80c5-c288eb96a643" body_link_text_color="#0B61C7" custom_margin_tablet="" custom_margin_phone="" custom_margin_last_edited="on|desktop" locked="off" global_colors_info="{}" body_link_text_color__hover_enabled="on|hover" body_link_text_color__hover="#007DBD"][et_pb_accordion_item title="What side effects should I look for after Mohs surgery?" open="on" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}"]

In most cases, Mohs surgery is a low-risk outpatient procedure. After surgery and reconstruction of the area, you may experience mild bleeding from the incision site, bruising, swelling, mild-to-moderate pain, and tenderness in the affected area. Any pain after Mohs surgery typically peaks 4-12 hours after the procedure and then gradually subsides over the following 3-4 days.Â 

A combination of acetaminophen (Tylenol) and ibuprofen (Advil) taken together, at the same time, is recommended for pain. Worsening pain after four days is concerning and may indicate an infection.Â 

We provide wound care instructions verbally and in writing. Additionally, we will call you during the day and the next day to follow up on your healing process after your Mohs surgery. Dr. Mario also tries to call all of his surgery patients at the end of the week to check on them. Most importantly, please do not hesitate to contact our office after any procedure; you are NOT bothering us to reach out. We would much rather have our patients reach out than have a problem and wait to contact us. Our surgery team provides a text number and a phone number. You may even call after hours and speak to Dr. Mario (just press â0â and ask the answering service to page Dr. Mario). We encourage it!

*Some patients should not take ibuprofen based on their other diseases. Patients with heart failure and chronic kidney disease are commonly advised not to take ibuprofen. Some patients on multiple blood-thinning medications (aspirin + Plavix, or aspirin + coumadin/Eliquis/etc.) will be advised not to take ibuprofen. If you have questions about this, please discuss them with Dr. Mario.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="What happens after the skin cancer is removed?" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}" open="off"]

After your Mohs skin cancer procedure, your doctor will immediately examine the wound and skin to determine the optimal way to manage the wound. Usually, that will mean suturing the wound closed. Sometimes, smaller wounds can heal without stitches. There is often no one correct answer, so frequently, it is decided after a discussion between Dr. Mario and the patient.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="What should I avoid after Mohs surgery?" _builder_version="4.21.0" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" body_link_text_color="gcid-67ca45d1-e275-42f7-b775-97f0494dc78c" global_colors_info="{%22gcid-67ca45d1-e275-42f7-b775-97f0494dc78c%22:%91%22body_link_text_color%22%93,%22gcid-3f7cd2dc-b68c-4cc5-803f-18348add3227%22:%91%22body_link_text_color__hover%22%93}" body_link_text_color__hover_enabled="on|hover" body_link_text_color__hover="#0862c8" open="off"]You will have a list of full aftercare instructions, but remember to keep the wound clean, away from sunlight, and avoid rigorous activities (which may burst the stitches). The healing time for areas without a lot of movements, such as the cheeks and forehead, is typically 1-2 weeks. For areas such as the arms that get more activity, typically, it is 2-3 weeks. For areas where there is a lot of movement (center of back, chest, or over a joint such as the shoulder or elbow), it can be 3-6 weeks.Â  Our advice is to ease back into regular activity slowly and then increase activity to higher levels if the wound feels okay. Basically, donât rest for a week and then run a marathon on day eight after surgery. In most cases, you can return to work the next day. If your job is more physically demanding, we may recommend âlight dutyâ during the healing period.[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="Will my hair grow back after Mohs surgery on the scalp?" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}" open="off"]

The answer depends on a variety of factors. If the skin cancer goes deep and the wound is not sutured closed, the hair will likely NOT regrow. If it is sutured closed (sides of the wound are brought together), it likely WILL regrow. If a skin graft is required, then the hair will not regrow. If this concerns you, please ask Dr. Mario, and he can explain the options to you.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="Is Mohs surgery more expensive than other treatments?" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}" open="off"]

Mohs surgery is as cost-effective as standard skin cancer excision but with a higher cure rate and a smaller scar. With Mohs surgery, the doctor acts as both the surgeon and the pathologist (looks at the skin cancer under the microscope to make sure all of the cancer is out). An additional advantage is that you get the result (âall clearâ) on the same day as the skin cancer removal. With a standard excision, the skin specimen is sent to an off-site laboratory, where the pathologist assesses it under the microscope. This can take up to one week.Â 

One last factor to consider is that because the pathology result (âall clearâ) happens on the same day with Mohs, more complex reconstructive surgery techniques such as skin flaps and grafts can be employed to close the wound after cancer removal.

Some doctors and plastic surgeons will use these techniques to close the incision before getting the result (âall clearâ) from the pathology lab. This is dangerous for the patient because if they have to go back to remove more skin cancer because the result is positive, the orientation of the skin cancer will be lost due to the flap or graft. In this scenario, it is best to ask for a referral for a Mohs surgeon immediately.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="Does health insurance cover Mohs?" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}" open="off"]

Almost all insurances will cover the cost of Mohs surgery for skin cancer treatment. Some less common skin tumors may not be covered by insurance, but the most common ones, squamous cell carcinoma, and basal cell carcinoma, are covered.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][/et_pb_accordion][et_pb_button button_url="@ET-DC@eyJkeW5hbWljIjp0cnVlLCJjb250ZW50IjoicG9zdF9saW5rX3VybF9wYWdlIiwic2V0dGluZ3MiOnsicG9zdF9pZCI6IjQwNSJ9fQ==@" button_text="Request Appointment" button_alignment="center" _builder_version="4.17.4" _dynamic_attributes="button_url" _module_preset="bd223fcb-a9b6-45f0-968d-b3087a4018b4" button_text_color="#0B61C7" button_bg_color="#FFD700" custom_margin="60px||||false|false" custom_margin_tablet="40px||||false|false" custom_margin_phone="40px||||false|false" custom_margin_last_edited="on|tablet" global_colors_info="{}" button_bg_color__hover="#0B61C7"][/et_pb_button][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]

So far all your focus keywords are unique, way to go!";s:9:"more_info";s:1153:" Whilst duplicate content isn't technically penalized it presents three rather niggly issues for search engines:

1. It's unclear which versions to include/exclude from their indexes.
2. They don't know whether to direct the link metrics (trust, authority, anchor text, link equity, etc.) to one page, or keep it separated between multiple versions.
3. The engine is unsure which version to rank for query results.

So whilst there's no direct penalty, if your content isn't unique then search engine algorithms could be filtering out your articles from their results. The easiest way to make sure this doesn't happen is to try and make each of your posts and pages as unique as possible, hence specifying different focus keywords for each article you write.

Note: If you happen to have two pages with the same content, it's important to tell search engines which one to show in search results using the Canonical URL feature. You can read more about this here. As a base for any article best practice suggests a minimum of 300 words, with 1000 being a good benchmark and 1600 being the optimal. Numerous studies have uncovered that longer content tends to perform better than shorter content, with pages having 1000 words or more performing best. Whilst optimizing your content for search engines is what we're going for here, a proven bi-product is that high quality long form articles also tend to get shared more on social platforms. With the increasing power of social media as a tool for traffic it's a nice flow on effect of writing those juicy high quality articles your readers are waiting for.";s:10:"status_msg";s:83:"The text contains 883 words which is more than the recommended minimum of 300 words";}s:15:"keyword_density";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:0;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:183:"Currently your keyword density is 0.68% which is below the recommended 1-3%. One way of making sure people will be able to find our content is using particular focus keywords, and using them as much as naturally possible in our content. In doing this we are trying to match up the keywords that people are likely to use when searching for this article or page, so try to get into your visitors mind and picture them typing a search into Google. You've already added 5 links, nice work!";s:9:"more_info";s:1261:" Internal links are important for linking together related content. Search engines will 'crawl' through your website, indexing pages and posts as they go. To help them discover all the juicy content your website has to offer, it's wise to make sure your content has internal links built in for bots to follow and index.

External links don't benefit your SEO by having them in your own content, but you'll want to try and get as many other websites linking to your articles and pages as possible. Search engines treat links to your website as a 'third party vote' in favour of your website - like a vote of confidence. Since they're the hardest form of 'validation' to get (another website has to endorse you!) search engines weight them heavily when considering page rank. For more info: https://moz.com/learn/seo/internal-link

Note: This check is only looking at the content your page is outputting and doesn't include your main navigation. Blogs with lots of posts will benefit the most from this method, as it aids Google in finding and indexing all of your content, not just the latest articles. ";s:10:"status_msg";s:56:"You have 4 internal and 1 external links in your content";}s:13:"para_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:171:"You've included your focus keywords in the first paragraph of your content, which will help search engines and visitors quickly scope the topic of your article. Well done!";s:9:"more_info";s:541:"You should clearly formulate what your post is about in the first paragraph. In printed texts, a writer usually starts off with some kind of teaser, but there is no time for that if you are writing for the web. You only have seconds to gain your readerâs attention. Make sure the first paragraph tells the main message of your post. That way, you make it easy for your reader to figure out what your post is about. Doing this also tells Google what your post is about. Donât forget to put your focus keyword in that first paragraph! ";s:10:"status_msg";s:64:"The focus keyword appears in the first paragraph of your article";}s:20:"subheadings_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:152:"You've used keywords in 6 of your subheadings which will help both the user and search engines quickly figure out what your article is about, good work!";s:9:"more_info";s:478:"When trying to rank for certain keywords, those keywords should be found in as many key places as possible. Given that you're writing about the topic it only makes sense that you mention it in at least one of your subheadings. Headings are important for users as they break up your content and help readers figure out what the text is about. Same goes for search engines. With that said, don't force keywords into all your titles - keep it natural, readable, and use moderation!";s:10:"status_msg";s:45:"Your focus keyword was found in 6 subheadings";}}}

meta._wds_metadesc: After Mohs surgery at Southern Skies Dermatology, you may have some questions. Here is some guidance on what to expect after your Mohs surgery.
meta._wds_trimmed_excerpt: After Your Visit Resources Frequently Asked Questions In most cases, Mohs surgery is a low-risk outpatient procedure. After surgery and reconstruction of the area, you may experience mild bleeding from the incision site, bruising, swelling, mild-to-moderate pain, and tenderness in the affected a ...

What to Expect - Our Office FAQ

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src="https://southernskiesdermatology.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Divider-small-new-yellow.png" title_text="Divider" align="center" align_tablet="center" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="04d09abd-7579-4b9c-808e-c7ad250d8198" locked="off" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_image][et_pb_accordion open_toggle_text_color="#0B61C7" closed_toggle_background_color="#0B61C7" _builder_version="4.27.2" _module_preset="bfc4e6c6-6cf5-4fa5-80c5-c288eb96a643" hover_enabled="0" border_color_all="#0B61C7" locked="off" global_colors_info="{}" body_link_text_color__hover_enabled="on|hover" body_link_text_color__hover="#0862C8" sticky_enabled="0"][et_pb_accordion_item title="What are the office hours at Southern Skies Dermatology and Surgery?" open="on" _builder_version="4.27.2" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" hover_enabled="0" global_colors_info="{}" sticky_enabled="0"]

[showmodule id="5940"]

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="What services can I expect from this clinic?" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}" open="off"]

In our clinic, our doctors specialize in and focus on diagnosing and treating skin cancers. We provide a full range of dermatological services, including full-body exams, mole removal, pre-cancer treatments such as cryotherapy and chemical peels, Mohs surgery, and post-Mohs plastic surgery reconstruction.

Our goal is to provide the best possible service and treatment for patients with skin cancer - and by concentrating specifically on skin cancer, our doctors are skillful and insightful when it comes to recognizing, diagnosing, and treating skin cancers.Â 

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="Does Southern Skies Dermatology accept my insurance?" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}" open="off"]

We do accept insurance! Please call our front desk at 205-900-2000 and speak to one of our friendly staff members, who will be happy to tell you which insurances we accept and make you an appointment straight away!

Unfortunately there isn't a rule book for SEO meta descriptions, just remember to make your description great for SEO, but also (most importantly) readable and enticing for potential visitors to click on.";s:10:"status_msg";s:49:"Your meta description is less than 135 characters";}s:13:"slug_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:0;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:195:"Google does index your page URL. Using your focus keywords in the page slug can help your page rank as you have a higher chance of matching search terms. Try getting your focus keywords in there.";s:9:"more_info";s:403:"The page URL you use for this post will be visible in search engine results, so it's important to also include words that the searcher is looking for (your focus keywords). It's debatable whether keywords in the slug are of any real search engine ranking benefit. One could assume that because the slug does get indexed, the algorithm may favour slugs more closely aligned with the topic being searched.";s:10:"status_msg";s:52:"You haven't used your focus keywords in the page URL";}s:13:"keywords_used";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:0;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:148:"Focus keywords are intended to be unique so you're less likely to write duplicate content. Consider changing the focus keywords to something unique.";s:9:"more_info";s:1153:" Whilst duplicate content isn't technically penalized it presents three rather niggly issues for search engines:

1. It's unclear which versions to include/exclude from their indexes.
2. They don't know whether to direct the link metrics (trust, authority, anchor text, link equity, etc.) to one page, or keep it separated between multiple versions.
3. The engine is unsure which version to rank for query results.

So whilst there's no direct penalty, if your content isn't unique then search engine algorithms could be filtering out your articles from their results. The easiest way to make sure this doesn't happen is to try and make each of your posts and pages as unique as possible, hence specifying different focus keywords for each article you write.

Note: If you happen to have two pages with the same content, it's important to tell search engines which one to show in search results using the Canonical URL feature. You can read more about this here. ";s:10:"status_msg";s:49:"You've used the focus keywords in another article";}s:16:"imgalts_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:0;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:309:"None of the images on this page have alt text containing your focus keyword. Itâs recommended practice to have your topic keywords in a few of your images to further associate the article with the topic youâre writing about. Add your keyword to one or more of your images, but be careful not to overdo it.";s:9:"more_info";s:244:"Image alternative text attributes help search engines correctly index images, aid visually impaired readers, and the text is used in place of the image if it's unable to load. You should add alternative text for all images in your content.";s:10:"status_msg";s:57:"None of your image alt texts contain the focus keyword(s)";}s:14:"content_length";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:0;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:138:"The best practice minimum content length for the web is 300 words so we recommend you aim for at least this amount - the more the merrier.";s:9:"more_info";s:798:"Content is ultimately the bread and butter of your SEO. Without words, your pages and posts will have a hard time ranking for the keywords you want them to. As a base for any article best practice suggests a minimum of 300 words, with 1000 being a good benchmark and 1600 being the optimal. Numerous studies have uncovered that longer content tends to perform better than shorter content, with pages having 1000 words or more performing best. Whilst optimizing your content for search engines is what we're going for here, a proven bi-product is that high quality long form articles also tend to get shared more on social platforms. With the increasing power of social media as a tool for traffic it's a nice flow on effect of writing those juicy high quality articles your readers are waiting for.";s:10:"status_msg";s:83:"The text contains 268 words which is less than the recommended minimum of 300 words";}s:15:"keyword_density";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:0;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:183:"Currently your keyword density is 0.62% which is below the recommended 1-3%. A low keyword density means your content has less chance of ranking highly for your chosen focus keywords.";s:9:"more_info";s:728:"Keyword density is all about making sure your content is populated with enough keywords to give it a better chance of appearing higher in search results. One way of making sure people will be able to find our content is using particular focus keywords, and using them as much as naturally possible in our content. In doing this we are trying to match up the keywords that people are likely to use when searching for this article or page, so try to get into your visitors mind and picture them typing a search into Google. While we recommend aiming for 1-3% density, remember content is king and you don't want your article to end up sounding like a robot. Get creative and utilize the page title, image caption, and subheadings.";s:10:"status_msg";s:36:"Your keyword density is less than 1%";}s:11:"links_count";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:161:"Internal links help search engines crawl your website, effectively pointing them to more pages to index on your website. You've already added 4 links, nice work!";s:9:"more_info";s:1261:" Internal links are important for linking together related content. Search engines will 'crawl' through your website, indexing pages and posts as they go. To help them discover all the juicy content your website has to offer, it's wise to make sure your content has internal links built in for bots to follow and index.

External links don't benefit your SEO by having them in your own content, but you'll want to try and get as many other websites linking to your articles and pages as possible. Search engines treat links to your website as a 'third party vote' in favour of your website - like a vote of confidence. Since they're the hardest form of 'validation' to get (another website has to endorse you!) search engines weight them heavily when considering page rank. For more info: https://moz.com/learn/seo/internal-link

Note: This check is only looking at the content your page is outputting and doesn't include your main navigation. Blogs with lots of posts will benefit the most from this method, as it aids Google in finding and indexing all of your content, not just the latest articles. ";s:10:"status_msg";s:56:"You have 3 internal and 1 external links in your content";}s:13:"para_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:0;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:169:"It's good practice to include your focus keywords in the first paragraph of your content so that search engines and visitors can quickly scope the topic of your article.";s:9:"more_info";s:541:"You should clearly formulate what your post is about in the first paragraph. In printed texts, a writer usually starts off with some kind of teaser, but there is no time for that if you are writing for the web. You only have seconds to gain your readerâs attention. Make sure the first paragraph tells the main message of your post. That way, you make it easy for your reader to figure out what your post is about. Doing this also tells Google what your post is about. Donât forget to put your focus keyword in that first paragraph! ";s:10:"status_msg";s:78:"You haven't included the focus keywords in the first paragraph of your article";}s:20:"subheadings_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:152:"You've used keywords in 2 of your subheadings which will help both the user and search engines quickly figure out what your article is about, good work!";s:9:"more_info";s:478:"When trying to rank for certain keywords, those keywords should be found in as many key places as possible. Given that you're writing about the topic it only makes sense that you mention it in at least one of your subheadings. Headings are important for users as they break up your content and help readers figure out what the text is about. Same goes for search engines. With that said, don't force keywords into all your titles - keep it natural, readable, and use moderation!";s:10:"status_msg";s:45:"Your focus keyword was found in 2 subheadings";}}}

Our main office at the St. Vincentâs East medical office building (the 48 building) in Trussville / East Birmingham is located near the intersection of I-59 and I-459. At this location, we provide total body skin exams, spot checks, biopsies, Mohs surgery, medical dermatology including rashes such as psoriasis and acne, as well as Botox. From this office, we provide a full suite of dermatology services to the communities of Gardendale, Fultondale, Irondale, Roebuck, Centerpoint, Trussville, Alton, Clay, Argo, Margaret, Odenville, Moody, Leeds, and many others.

âI was extremely pleased with my experience at Southern Skies. Dr. Mario and his NP, Adrienne, removed a large basal cell on the top of my lip. It was a very extensive procedure resulting in more than 40 external stitches. Within a month the scar was barely noticeable. Much care and thought were given to how and where to make the incisions. Taking into account my facial creases, wrinkles, etc., the scar is almost completely hidden. I recommend them highly!â

[/dica_divi_carouselitem][dica_divi_carouselitem title="Rebecca Long, Gadsden" button_url_new_window="1" use_rating="on" rating_alignment="center" rating_position="rating-top" rating_icon_size="41px" rating_color="#FFD700" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="default" header_level="h2" header_text_align="center" header_font_size="20px" body_text_align="center" global_colors_info="{}"]

âIâm very pleased with the care and concern of this staff. Dr. M did a great job on my ear. The reconstruction looks wonderful. You have to look really close to tell anything was done. They are professionals, but they treat me like family.âÂ 

[/dica_divi_carouselitem][dica_divi_carouselitem title="Michael Brown, Ohatchee" button_url_new_window="1" use_rating="on" rating_alignment="center" rating_position="rating-top" rating_icon_size="41px" rating_color="#FFD700" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="default" header_level="h2" header_text_align="center" header_font_size="20px" body_text_align="center" global_colors_info="{}"]

âToday was my doctor visit day at Southern Skies. I never want to go to the doctor, but I know how important it s for my health. I can say that Dr. Mario and his staff are very professional in their treatment. They make me feel secure with their treatment and knowledge.â

[/dica_divi_carouselitem][/dica_divi_carousel][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section][et_pb_section fb_built="1" custom_padding_last_edited="on|tablet" admin_label="Make Appointment Section" module_class="justify-center" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" background_enable_color="off" use_background_color_gradient="on" background_color_gradient_stops="rgba(255,255,255,0.95) 50%|rgba(255,255,255,0.73) 84%" background_color_gradient_overlays_image="on" background_image="https://southernskiesdermatology.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/04/cropped-view-of-dermatologist-holding-magnifying-g-2021-08-30-01-48-32-utc.jpg" custom_margin="0px||0px||false|false" custom_padding="65px||65px||true|false" custom_padding_tablet="50px||50px||true|false" custom_padding_phone="50px||50px||true|false" locked="off" global_colors_info="{}"][et_pb_row _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" custom_margin="0px||0px||true|false" custom_padding="0px||0px||true|false" global_colors_info="{}"][et_pb_column type="4_4" admin_label="Column" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" custom_padding="60px||60px||true|false" custom_padding_tablet="0px||0px||true|false" custom_padding_phone="0px||0px||true|false" custom_padding_last_edited="on|tablet" global_colors_info="{}"][et_pb_text module_class="section-title" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="5f610831-85d0-4eae-810b-b1fd2a189de5" header_2_font="||||||||" header_2_text_align="center" custom_padding="||0px||false|false" header_2_text_align_tablet="center" locked="off" global_colors_info="{}" header_2_line_height__hover_enabled="off|desktop"]

Consider changing the focus keywords to something unique.";s:9:"more_info";s:1153:" Whilst duplicate content isn't technically penalized it presents three rather niggly issues for search engines:

1. It's unclear which versions to include/exclude from their indexes.
2. They don't know whether to direct the link metrics (trust, authority, anchor text, link equity, etc.) to one page, or keep it separated between multiple versions.
3. The engine is unsure which version to rank for query results.

So whilst there's no direct penalty, if your content isn't unique then search engine algorithms could be filtering out your articles from their results. The easiest way to make sure this doesn't happen is to try and make each of your posts and pages as unique as possible, hence specifying different focus keywords for each article you write.

Note: If you happen to have two pages with the same content, it's important to tell search engines which one to show in search results using the Canonical URL feature. As a base for any article best practice suggests a minimum of 300 words, with 1000 being a good benchmark and 1600 being the optimal. Numerous studies have uncovered that longer content tends to perform better than shorter content, with pages having 1000 words or more performing best. Whilst optimizing your content for search engines is what we're going for here, a proven bi-product is that high quality long form articles also tend to get shared more on social platforms. With the increasing power of social media as a tool for traffic it's a nice flow on effect of writing those juicy high quality articles your readers are waiting for.";s:10:"status_msg";s:83:"The text contains 536 words which is more than the recommended minimum of 300 words";}s:15:"keyword_density";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:196:"Currently you haven't used any keywords in your content. You've already added 11 links, nice work!";s:9:"more_info";s:1261:" Internal links are important for linking together related content. Search engines will 'crawl' through your website, indexing pages and posts as they go. To help them discover all the juicy content your website has to offer, it's wise to make sure your content has internal links built in for bots to follow and index.

External links don't benefit your SEO by having them in your own content, but you'll want to try and get as many other websites linking to your articles and pages as possible. Search engines treat links to your website as a 'third party vote' in favour of your website - like a vote of confidence. Since they're the hardest form of 'validation' to get (another website has to endorse you!) search engines weight them heavily when considering page rank. For more info: https://moz.com/learn/seo/internal-link

Note: This check is only looking at the content your page is outputting and doesn't include your main navigation. With that said, don't force keywords into all your titles - keep it natural, readable, and use moderation!";s:10:"status_msg";s:46:"Your focus keyword was found in 11 subheadings";}}}

Best practices suggest keeping your titles between 50 and 65 characters including spaces, though in some cases 60 is the sweetspot. The length is important both for SEO ranking but also how your title will show up in search engines - long titles will be cut off visually and look bad. Unfortunately there isn't a rule book for SEO titles, just remember to make your title great for SEO but also (most importantly) readable and enticing for potential visitors to click on.";s:10:"status_msg";s:31:"Your SEO title is a good length";}s:17:"metadesc_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:159:"The focus keyword for this article appears in the SEO description which means it has a better chance of matching what your visitors will search for, brilliant!";s:9:"more_info";s:456:"It's considered good practice to try to include your focus keyword(s) in the SEO description of your pages, because this is what people looking for the article are likely searching for. The higher chance of a keyword match, the higher chance your article will be found higher up in search results. Remember this is your chance to give a potential visitor a quick peek into what's inside your article. If they like what they read they'll click on your link.";s:10:"status_msg";s:48:"The SEO description contains your focus keywords";}s:15:"metadesc_length";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:0;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:132:"Your SEO description (or excerpt) is currently too short which means it has less of a chance ranking for your chosen focus keywords.";s:9:"more_info";s:505:"We recommend keeping your meta descriptions between 135 and 300 characters (including spaces). Doing so achieves a nice balance between populating your description with keywords to rank highly in search engines, and also keeping it to a readable length that won't be cut off in search engine results. Unfortunately there isn't a rule book for SEO meta descriptions, just remember to make your description great for SEO, but also (most importantly) readable and enticing for potential visitors to click on.";s:10:"status_msg";s:49:"Your meta description is less than 135 characters";}s:13:"slug_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:0;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:195:"Google does index your page URL. Using your focus keywords in the page slug can help your page rank as you have a higher chance of matching search terms. Try getting your focus keywords in there.";s:9:"more_info";s:403:"The page URL you use for this post will be visible in search engine results, so it's important to also include words that the searcher is looking for (your focus keywords). It's debatable whether keywords in the slug are of any real search engine ranking benefit. One could assume that because the slug does get indexed, the algorithm may favour slugs more closely aligned with the topic being searched.";s:10:"status_msg";s:52:"You haven't used your focus keywords in the page URL";}s:13:"keywords_used";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:144:"Focus keywords are intended to be unique so you're less likely to write duplicate content. So far all your focus keywords are unique, way to go!";s:9:"more_info";s:1153:" Whilst duplicate content isn't technically penalized it presents three rather niggly issues for search engines:

1. It's unclear which versions to include/exclude from their indexes.
2. They don't know whether to direct the link metrics (trust, authority, anchor text, link equity, etc.) to one page, or keep it separated between multiple versions.
3. The engine is unsure which version to rank for query results.

So whilst there's no direct penalty, if your content isn't unique then search engine algorithms could be filtering out your articles from their results. The easiest way to make sure this doesn't happen is to try and make each of your posts and pages as unique as possible, hence specifying different focus keywords for each article you write.

Note: If you happen to have two pages with the same content, it's important to tell search engines which one to show in search results using the Canonical URL feature. You can read more about this here. ";s:10:"status_msg";s:42:"You haven't used this focus keyword before";}s:16:"imgalts_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:0;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:309:"None of the images on this page have alt text containing your focus keyword. Itâs recommended practice to have your topic keywords in a few of your images to further associate the article with the topic youâre writing about. Add your keyword to one or more of your images, but be careful not to overdo it.";s:9:"more_info";s:244:"Image alternative text attributes help search engines correctly index images, aid visually impaired readers, and the text is used in place of the image if it's unable to load. You should add alternative text for all images in your content.";s:10:"status_msg";s:57:"None of your image alt texts contain the focus keyword(s)";}s:14:"content_length";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:74:"Your content is longer than the recommend minimum of 300 words, excellent!";s:9:"more_info";s:798:"Content is ultimately the bread and butter of your SEO. Without words, your pages and posts will have a hard time ranking for the keywords you want them to. As a base for any article best practice suggests a minimum of 300 words, with 1000 being a good benchmark and 1600 being the optimal. Numerous studies have uncovered that longer content tends to perform better than shorter content, with pages having 1000 words or more performing best. Whilst optimizing your content for search engines is what we're going for here, a proven bi-product is that high quality long form articles also tend to get shared more on social platforms. With the increasing power of social media as a tool for traffic it's a nice flow on effect of writing those juicy high quality articles your readers are waiting for.";s:10:"status_msg";s:83:"The text contains 383 words which is more than the recommended minimum of 300 words";}s:15:"keyword_density";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:0;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:182:"Currently your keyword density is 0.5% which is below the recommended 1-3%. A low keyword density means your content has less chance of ranking highly for your chosen focus keywords.";s:9:"more_info";s:728:"Keyword density is all about making sure your content is populated with enough keywords to give it a better chance of appearing higher in search results. One way of making sure people will be able to find our content is using particular focus keywords, and using them as much as naturally possible in our content. In doing this we are trying to match up the keywords that people are likely to use when searching for this article or page, so try to get into your visitors mind and picture them typing a search into Google. While we recommend aiming for 1-3% density, remember content is king and you don't want your article to end up sounding like a robot. Get creative and utilize the page title, image caption, and subheadings.";s:10:"status_msg";s:36:"Your keyword density is less than 1%";}s:11:"links_count";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:161:"Internal links help search engines crawl your website, effectively pointing them to more pages to index on your website. You've already added 2 links, nice work!";s:9:"more_info";s:1261:" Internal links are important for linking together related content. Search engines will 'crawl' through your website, indexing pages and posts as they go. To help them discover all the juicy content your website has to offer, it's wise to make sure your content has internal links built in for bots to follow and index.

External links don't benefit your SEO by having them in your own content, but you'll want to try and get as many other websites linking to your articles and pages as possible. Search engines treat links to your website as a 'third party vote' in favour of your website - like a vote of confidence. Since they're the hardest form of 'validation' to get (another website has to endorse you!) search engines weight them heavily when considering page rank. For more info: https://moz.com/learn/seo/internal-link

Note: This check is only looking at the content your page is outputting and doesn't include your main navigation. Blogs with lots of posts will benefit the most from this method, as it aids Google in finding and indexing all of your content, not just the latest articles. ";s:10:"status_msg";s:56:"You have 1 internal and 1 external links in your content";}s:13:"para_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:0;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:169:"It's good practice to include your focus keywords in the first paragraph of your content so that search engines and visitors can quickly scope the topic of your article.";s:9:"more_info";s:541:"You should clearly formulate what your post is about in the first paragraph. In printed texts, a writer usually starts off with some kind of teaser, but there is no time for that if you are writing for the web. You only have seconds to gain your readerâs attention. Make sure the first paragraph tells the main message of your post. That way, you make it easy for your reader to figure out what your post is about. Doing this also tells Google what your post is about. Donât forget to put your focus keyword in that first paragraph! ";s:10:"status_msg";s:78:"You haven't included the focus keywords in the first paragraph of your article";}s:20:"subheadings_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:152:"You've used keywords in 1 of your subheadings which will help both the user and search engines quickly figure out what your article is about, good work!";s:9:"more_info";s:478:"When trying to rank for certain keywords, those keywords should be found in as many key places as possible. Given that you're writing about the topic it only makes sense that you mention it in at least one of your subheadings. Headings are important for users as they break up your content and help readers figure out what the text is about. Same goes for search engines. With that said, don't force keywords into all your titles - keep it natural, readable, and use moderation!";s:10:"status_msg";s:45:"Your focus keyword was found in 1 subheadings";}}}

1. It's unclear which versions to include/exclude from their indexes.
2. They don't know whether to direct the link metrics (trust, authority, anchor text, link equity, etc.) to one page, or keep it separated between multiple versions.
3. The engine is unsure which version to rank for query results.

So whilst there's no direct penalty, if your content isn't unique then search engine algorithms could be filtering out your articles from their results. The easiest way to make sure this doesn't happen is to try and make each of your posts and pages as unique as possible, hence specifying different focus keywords for each article you write.

Note: If you happen to have two pages with the same content, it's important to tell search engines which one to show in search results using the Canonical URL feature. To help them discover all the juicy content your website has to offer, it's wise to make sure your content has internal links built in for bots to follow and index.

External links don't benefit your SEO by having them in your own content, but you'll want to try and get as many other websites linking to your articles and pages as possible. Search engines treat links to your website as a 'third party vote' in favour of your website - like a vote of confidence. Since they're the hardest form of 'validation' to get (another website has to endorse you!) search engines weight them heavily when considering page rank. For more info: https://moz.com/learn/seo/internal-link

1. It's unclear which versions to include/exclude from their indexes.
2. They don't know whether to direct the link metrics (trust, authority, anchor text, link equity, etc.) to one page, or keep it separated between multiple versions.
3. The engine is unsure which version to rank for query results.

So whilst there's no direct penalty, if your content isn't unique then search engine algorithms could be filtering out your articles from their results. The easiest way to make sure this doesn't happen is to try and make each of your posts and pages as unique as possible, hence specifying different focus keywords for each article you write.

Note: If you happen to have two pages with the same content, it's important to tell search engines which one to show in search results using the Canonical URL feature. You've already added 2 links, nice work!";s:9:"more_info";s:1261:" Internal links are important for linking together related content. Search engines will 'crawl' through your website, indexing pages and posts as they go. To help them discover all the juicy content your website has to offer, it's wise to make sure your content has internal links built in for bots to follow and index.

External links don't benefit your SEO by having them in your own content, but you'll want to try and get as many other websites linking to your articles and pages as possible. Search engines treat links to your website as a 'third party vote' in favour of your website - like a vote of confidence. Since they're the hardest form of 'validation' to get (another website has to endorse you!) search engines weight them heavily when considering page rank. For more info: https://moz.com/learn/seo/internal-link

Note: This check is only looking at the content your page is outputting and doesn't include your main navigation. meta._wds_title: Refer a Patient to Southern Skies Dermatology and Surgery
meta._wds_metadesc: It's easy to refer a patient to Southern Skies Dermatology whether you are a doctors office or a concerned spouse or friend.
meta._wds_trimmed_excerpt: Refer A Patient to Our Practice Refer a Patient Phone options: Option 1 Birmingham / Trusville Front Desk and Appointments Option 2 Gadsden Front Desk Option 3 Surgery Scheduling - Pathology Results or Medical Records Option 4 Billing or Cancer Policies Option 5 Dr. Maruthur and surgery team Opt ...

Before Your Mohs Skin Cancer Surgery

Medications we need to know about include blood-thinning medications including aspirin, Plavix, and coumadin, immunosuppressing medications such as prednisone and methotrexate, and any antibiotics you may currently be taking. If youâre unsure, be sure to alert our staff so that we can assess further.Â Â 

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="Watch your herbal supplements" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}" open="off"]

Your doctor may recommend you stop taking certain herbal supplements or vitamins before your surgery, as they increase the risk of bleeding. This often includes Ginkgo Biloba, vitamin E, vitamin C, fish oil, and ginseng.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="The day before your surgery" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}" open="off"]

Please (please!) avoid alcohol for at least 24-48 hours before your surgery.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][/et_pb_accordion][et_pb_text module_class="section-title" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="5f610831-85d0-4eae-810b-b1fd2a189de5" header_2_font="||||||||" header_2_text_align="center" custom_margin="100px||10px||false|false" custom_padding="||0px||false|false" header_2_text_align_tablet="center" locked="off" global_colors_info="{}" header_2_line_height__hover_enabled="off|desktop"]

The Day of Your Surgery

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src="https://southernskiesdermatology.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Divider-small-new-yellow.png" title_text="Divider" align="center" align_tablet="center" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="04d09abd-7579-4b9c-808e-c7ad250d8198" locked="off" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_image][et_pb_accordion open_toggle_text_color="#0B61C7" closed_toggle_background_color="#0B61C7" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="bfc4e6c6-6cf5-4fa5-80c5-c288eb96a643" custom_margin_tablet="" custom_margin_phone="" custom_margin_last_edited="on|desktop" border_color_all="#0B61C7" locked="off" global_colors_info="{}" custom_padding__hover_enabled="off|desktop"][et_pb_accordion_item title="Shower or bathe" open="on" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}"]

to minimize the risk of infection.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="Avoid makeup" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}" open="off"]

if your surgery is on your facial area.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="Take all your scheduled prescribed medications" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}" open="off"]

and bring them with you if necessary. You may continue to take aspirin and any other blood-thinning medications. Let your doctors know about your prescriptions.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="Eat a good breakfast" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}" open="off"]

and prepare to spend the day with us. Given the number and extent of the skin cancers being treated, you should plan on being at our office between 2-4 hours, and sometimes even longer for more invasive skin cancers. Please be aware that even though your skin cancer may not be very severe, the patient in the next room may have extensive skin cancer on a sensitive area (nose, ear, lip) that requires extra time and attention by the doctor. Dr. Mario spends whatever time is necessary with every patient, even if it causes delays. We do not cut corners or skimp on quality.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="Wear comfortable clothing" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}" open="off"]

that allows easy access to the area where you will be having surgery. Consider bringing a jacket or pullover sweater as the rooms can sometimes be cold. We do have blankets on hand to make you more comfortable.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="Bring something to do" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}" open="off"]

Mohs surgery can take several hours, and you will be awake while the area is anesthetized. Charge your phone, bring a book, or even bring a friend or relative with you for support. We do try to keep our clinic fully stocked with complimentary beverages and snacks!

Most importantly, we encourage you to communicate any concerns or questions before, during, and after your procedure. Anyone on our Southern Skies Dermatology and Surgery team will be happy to talk to you!

[/et_pb_accordion_item][/et_pb_accordion][et_pb_button button_url="@ET-DC@eyJkeW5hbWljIjp0cnVlLCJjb250ZW50IjoicG9zdF9saW5rX3VybF9wYWdlIiwic2V0dGluZ3MiOnsicG9zdF9pZCI6IjQwNSJ9fQ==@" button_text="Request Appointment" button_alignment="center" _builder_version="4.17.4" _dynamic_attributes="button_url" _module_preset="bd223fcb-a9b6-45f0-968d-b3087a4018b4" button_text_color="#0B61C7" button_bg_color="#FFD700" custom_margin="60px||||false|false" custom_margin_tablet="40px||||false|false" custom_margin_phone="40px||||false|false" custom_margin_last_edited="on|tablet" global_colors_info="{}" button_bg_color__hover="#0B61C7"][/et_pb_button][/et_pb_column][/et_pb_row][/et_pb_section]

âI was extremely pleased with my experience at Southern Skies. Dr. Mario and his NP, Adrienne, removed a large basal cell on the top of my lip. It was a very extensive procedure resulting in more than 40 external stitches. Within a month the scar was barely noticeable. Much care and thought were given to how and where to make the incisions. Taking into account my facial creases, wrinkles, etc., the scar is almost completely hidden. I recommend them highly!â

Consider changing the focus keywords to something unique.";s:9:"more_info";s:1153:" Whilst duplicate content isn't technically penalized it presents three rather niggly issues for search engines:

1. It's unclear which versions to include/exclude from their indexes.
2. They don't know whether to direct the link metrics (trust, authority, anchor text, link equity, etc.) to one page, or keep it separated between multiple versions.
3. The engine is unsure which version to rank for query results.

So whilst there's no direct penalty, if your content isn't unique then search engine algorithms could be filtering out your articles from their results. The easiest way to make sure this doesn't happen is to try and make each of your posts and pages as unique as possible, hence specifying different focus keywords for each article you write.

Note: If you happen to have two pages with the same content, it's important to tell search engines which one to show in search results using the Canonical URL feature. Birminghamâs Top Skin Biopsy Practice

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src="https://southernskiesdermatology.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Divider-small-new-yellow.png" title_text="Divider" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="04d09abd-7579-4b9c-808e-c7ad250d8198" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="399dc1c6-5b92-4bd9-a1dd-0455d30e3551" text_font_size="22px" custom_margin_tablet="||20px||false|false" custom_margin_phone="||30px||false|false" custom_margin_last_edited="on|phone" global_colors_info="{}"]

A skin biopsy procedure is used by dermatologists to identify and diagnose various skin conditions, including skin cancer, benign (not dangerous) skin growths, and skin rashes. Performed under local anesthetic, the doctor takes a small sample which is sent for examination under a microscope by a pathologist. Patients are notified of the biopsy result as soon as they are available, which is typically 2-7 days.

global_colors_info="{}"]

About Skin Biopsies

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src="https://southernskiesdermatology.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Divider-small-new-yellow.png" title_text="Divider" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="04d09abd-7579-4b9c-808e-c7ad250d8198" locked="off" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_image][et_pb_text _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="399dc1c6-5b92-4bd9-a1dd-0455d30e3551" link_text_color="#0B61C7" global_colors_info="{}" link_text_color__hover_enabled="on|hover" link_text_color__hover="#007DBD"]

Biopsies are vital in the medical community as this simple procedure can identify most skin conditions troubling patients. Relatively painless, a skin biopsy procedure does require some care once completed. Youâll want to keep the area clean, moisturize with petroleum jelly, and keep it covered to allow the skin to heal fully with minimal scarring. Often, after a check-up or skin examination, the doctor may order a biopsy to be done in-office. The type of biopsy depends on the suspected skin condition.Â

Frequently Asked Questions

[/et_pb_text][et_pb_image src="https://southernskiesdermatology.com/wp-content/uploads/2022/11/Divider-small-new-yellow.png" title_text="Divider" align="center" align_tablet="center" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="04d09abd-7579-4b9c-808e-c7ad250d8198" locked="off" global_colors_info="{}"][/et_pb_image][et_pb_accordion open_toggle_text_color="#0B61C7" closed_toggle_background_color="#0B61C7" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="bfc4e6c6-6cf5-4fa5-80c5-c288eb96a643" body_link_text_color="#0B61C7" border_color_all="#0B61C7" locked="off" global_colors_info="{}" body_link_text_color__hover_enabled="on|hover" body_link_text_color__hover="#007DBD"][et_pb_accordion_item title=" What kind of skin biopsy do I need?" open="on" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}"]

Your dermatologist will only recommend a biopsy if it is necessary to diagnose a condition. They will choose the required method. Tangential shave biopsies followed by punch biopsies are the most common and can provide a thorough report.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="How are skin biopsies done?" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}" open="off"]

There are a few different types of skin biopsies. The procedure is similar for many of them, although different tools are used.Â 

A tangential shave biopsy is used for superficial lesions and takes a tiny tissue sample from the skin's upper portion. It is used to diagnose skin cancers, benign growths, and other conditions that develop near the skin's surface.

A punch biopsy uses a small stainless steel bladed tool called a trephine, which looks like a small cookie cutter, explicitly created for this procedure. This allows the doctor to sample a small 'plug' of skin with all the layers allowing for a more comprehensive diagnosis. Punch biopsies are often required to diagnose many skin rashes. This is also the biopsy type of choice for diagnosing suspicious skin lesions that are highly concerning for melanoma.Â 

An incisional biopsy is a more extensive biopsy usually performed with a scalpel and often requiring stitches. It provides the doctor with a larger skin sample for analysis.Â 

An excisional biopsy is when the doctor removes the entire concerning skin lesion, usually with a scalpel. This is the most thorough type of biopsy and is performed when there is a high level of concern. Excisional biopsies are also done when the doctor is highly confident of the diagnosis and does not want to re-treat the lesion later with another procedure or when the doctor feels that a large sample is required for an accurate diagnosis of the skin lesion.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="What's the recovery process after a biopsy?" _builder_version="4.17.4" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}" body_link_text_color__hover_enabled="off|desktop" body_link_text_color__hover="#0862C8" open="off"]

It is typically a minimally invasive procedure done by professionals in a clean environment under a local anesthetic. You can expect that you will have an open wound that will be bandaged or stitched up, and you will receive specific care instructions from your doctor. You will have to make sure to clean the wound with mild soap and water, as well as change the dressing daily until the wound is healed. Worsening pain 3-4 days after the biopsy should be quickly reported to the doctor, as this may indicate bacterial infection of the wound.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][et_pb_accordion_item title="Are skin biopsies painful?" _builder_version="4.17.1" _module_preset="default" body_line_height="33px" global_colors_info="{}" open="off"]

Typically, there is minimal pain. The most painful part of the procedure is numbing the area with the local anesthetic, which is typically lidocaine. You may experience some discomfort or pain afterward once the lidocaine wears off. Taking acetaminophen (Tylenol) and ibuprofen (if you are allowed to take it) will relieve any post-biopsy pain.

[/et_pb_accordion_item][/et_pb_accordion][et_pb_button button_url="@ET-DC@eyJkeW5hbWljIjp0cnVlLCJjb250ZW50IjoicG9zdF9saW5rX3VybF9wYWdlIiwic2V0dGluZ3MiOnsicG9zdF9pZCI6IjQwNSJ9fQ==@" You'll want to make sure that you have your focus keywords in there, that it's a nice length, and that people will want to click on it. Best practices suggest keeping your titles between 50 and 65 characters including spaces, though in some cases 60 is the sweetspot. The length is important both for SEO ranking but also how your title will show up in search engines - long titles will be cut off visually and look bad. Unfortunately there isn't a rule book for SEO titles, just remember to make your title great for SEO but also (most importantly) readable and enticing for potential visitors to click on.";s:10:"status_msg";s:27:"Your SEO title is too short";}s:17:"metadesc_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:159:"The focus keyword for this article appears in the SEO description which means it has a better chance of matching what your visitors will search for, brilliant!";s:9:"more_info";s:456:"It's considered good practice to try to include your focus keyword(s) in the SEO description of your pages, because this is what people looking for the article are likely searching for. The higher chance of a keyword match, the higher chance your article will be found higher up in search results. Remember this is your chance to give a potential visitor a quick peek into what's inside your article. If they like what they read they'll click on your link.";s:10:"status_msg";s:48:"The SEO description contains your focus keywords";}s:15:"metadesc_length";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:159:"Your SEO description is a good length. Having an SEO description that is either too long or too short can harm your chances of ranking highly for this article.";s:9:"more_info";s:505:"We recommend keeping your meta descriptions between 135 and 300 characters (including spaces). Doing so achieves a nice balance between populating your description with keywords to rank highly in search engines, and also keeping it to a readable length that won't be cut off in search engine results. Unfortunately there isn't a rule book for SEO meta descriptions, just remember to make your description great for SEO, but also (most importantly) readable and enticing for potential visitors to click on.";s:10:"status_msg";s:38:"Your meta description is a good length";}s:13:"slug_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:181:"You've got your focus keywords in the page slug which can help your page rank as you have a higher chance of matching search terms, and Google does index your page URL, great stuff!";s:9:"more_info";s:403:"The page URL you use for this post will be visible in search engine results, so it's important to also include words that the searcher is looking for (your focus keywords). It's debatable whether keywords in the slug are of any real search engine ranking benefit. One could assume that because the slug does get indexed, the algorithm may favour slugs more closely aligned with the topic being searched.";s:10:"status_msg";s:46:"You've used your focus keyword in the page URL";}s:13:"keywords_used";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:144:"Focus keywords are intended to be unique so you're less likely to write duplicate content. So far all your focus keywords are unique, way to go!";s:9:"more_info";s:1153:" Whilst duplicate content isn't technically penalized it presents three rather niggly issues for search engines:

1. It's unclear which versions to include/exclude from their indexes.
2. They don't know whether to direct the link metrics (trust, authority, anchor text, link equity, etc.) to one page, or keep it separated between multiple versions.
3. The engine is unsure which version to rank for query results.

So whilst there's no direct penalty, if your content isn't unique then search engine algorithms could be filtering out your articles from their results. The easiest way to make sure this doesn't happen is to try and make each of your posts and pages as unique as possible, hence specifying different focus keywords for each article you write.

Note: If you happen to have two pages with the same content, it's important to tell search engines which one to show in search results using the Canonical URL feature. You can read more about this here. ";s:10:"status_msg";s:42:"You haven't used this focus keyword before";}s:16:"imgalts_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:0;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:309:"None of the images on this page have alt text containing your focus keyword. Itâs recommended practice to have your topic keywords in a few of your images to further associate the article with the topic youâre writing about. Add your keyword to one or more of your images, but be careful not to overdo it.";s:9:"more_info";s:244:"Image alternative text attributes help search engines correctly index images, aid visually impaired readers, and the text is used in place of the image if it's unable to load. You should add alternative text for all images in your content.";s:10:"status_msg";s:57:"None of your image alt texts contain the focus keyword(s)";}s:14:"content_length";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:74:"Your content is longer than the recommend minimum of 300 words, excellent!";s:9:"more_info";s:798:"Content is ultimately the bread and butter of your SEO. Without words, your pages and posts will have a hard time ranking for the keywords you want them to. As a base for any article best practice suggests a minimum of 300 words, with 1000 being a good benchmark and 1600 being the optimal. Numerous studies have uncovered that longer content tends to perform better than shorter content, with pages having 1000 words or more performing best. Whilst optimizing your content for search engines is what we're going for here, a proven bi-product is that high quality long form articles also tend to get shared more on social platforms. With the increasing power of social media as a tool for traffic it's a nice flow on effect of writing those juicy high quality articles your readers are waiting for.";s:10:"status_msg";s:84:"The text contains 1021 words which is more than the recommended minimum of 300 words";}s:15:"keyword_density";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:0;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:183:"Currently your keyword density is 0.67% which is below the recommended 1-3%. A low keyword density means your content has less chance of ranking highly for your chosen focus keywords.";s:9:"more_info";s:728:"Keyword density is all about making sure your content is populated with enough keywords to give it a better chance of appearing higher in search results. One way of making sure people will be able to find our content is using particular focus keywords, and using them as much as naturally possible in our content. In doing this we are trying to match up the keywords that people are likely to use when searching for this article or page, so try to get into your visitors mind and picture them typing a search into Google. While we recommend aiming for 1-3% density, remember content is king and you don't want your article to end up sounding like a robot. Get creative and utilize the page title, image caption, and subheadings.";s:10:"status_msg";s:36:"Your keyword density is less than 1%";}s:11:"links_count";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:162:"Internal links help search engines crawl your website, effectively pointing them to more pages to index on your website. You've already added 13 links, nice work!";s:9:"more_info";s:1261:" Internal links are important for linking together related content. Search engines will 'crawl' through your website, indexing pages and posts as they go. To help them discover all the juicy content your website has to offer, it's wise to make sure your content has internal links built in for bots to follow and index.

External links don't benefit your SEO by having them in your own content, but you'll want to try and get as many other websites linking to your articles and pages as possible. Search engines treat links to your website as a 'third party vote' in favour of your website - like a vote of confidence. Since they're the hardest form of 'validation' to get (another website has to endorse you!) search engines weight them heavily when considering page rank. For more info: https://moz.com/learn/seo/internal-link

Note: This check is only looking at the content your page is outputting and doesn't include your main navigation. Blogs with lots of posts will benefit the most from this method, as it aids Google in finding and indexing all of your content, not just the latest articles. ";s:10:"status_msg";s:56:"You have 9 internal and 4 external links in your content";}s:13:"para_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:171:"You've included your focus keywords in the first paragraph of your content, which will help search engines and visitors quickly scope the topic of your article. Well done!";s:9:"more_info";s:541:"You should clearly formulate what your post is about in the first paragraph. In printed texts, a writer usually starts off with some kind of teaser, but there is no time for that if you are writing for the web. You only have seconds to gain your readerâs attention. Make sure the first paragraph tells the main message of your post. That way, you make it easy for your reader to figure out what your post is about. Doing this also tells Google what your post is about. Donât forget to put your focus keyword in that first paragraph! ";s:10:"status_msg";s:64:"The focus keyword appears in the first paragraph of your article";}s:20:"subheadings_keywords";a:5:{s:6:"status";b:1;s:7:"ignored";b:0;s:14:"recommendation";s:152:"You've used keywords in 7 of your subheadings which will help both the user and search engines quickly figure out what your article is about, good work!";s:9:"more_info";s:478:"When trying to rank for certain keywords, those keywords should be found in as many key places as possible. Given that you're writing about the topic it only makes sense that you mention it in at least one of your subheadings. Headings are important for users as they break up your content and help readers figure out what the text is about. Same goes for search engines. With that said, don't force keywords into all your titles - keep it natural, readable, and use moderation!";s:10:"status_msg";s:45:"Your focus keyword was found in 7 subheadings";}}}
